long_desc.thetext:
The -q option to generate.py should, IMO, only allow output of warnings and errors. Furthermore, it should be possible to have only errors reported. A successful build, therefore, could generate no output. This is very useful for scripting builds, and is consistent with most compilers which typically generate no output except for errors and warnings, and typically provide options to exclude various types of warnings from the output.
Currently, in quiet mode, a series of percent completion progress bars are presented. These are great in verbose mode, but should not be present in quiet mode, particularly since the label indicating what they are progress for is (appropriately) excluded.
See also bug #1489 which also applies to using the generator in a script.
@Thomas, isn't this issue resolved with your recent changes (presumably by also piping stdout or stderr accordingly)?

Fixed in trunk. The -q output now also suppresses the progress indication.
If you feel there should be further switches to exclude warnings, errors and fatal errors, please add a new bug to that end.
mass correction: set previously unspecified target milestone to 0.8.1
Closed all bugs already shipped with a release.
